posts.author: MonkeyBusinessDM
posts.content:
I've been thinking about balance lately and wanted to get everyone's opinions.

Quick question about balance that came up in our game last night.

I'd love to hear everyone's experiences with balance and how it's worked in your games.

What do you all think? Has anyone else had similar questions about balance?

posts.author: DMScreener
posts.content:
In our last session, we encountered a Beholder and tried to use balance to gain an advantage, but it didn't work out as planned.

The best campaign moment I ever had involved creative use of balance to solve what seemed like an impossible puzzle.

I think the 2024 changes to balance make it much more balanced compared to before.

In my campaign, we had a situation with balance that played out really well. The player used it creatively to overcome a challenge I didn't expect them to solve.

posts.author: BardTales
posts.content:
The best campaign moment I ever had involved creative use of balance to solve what seemed like an impossible puzzle.

My DM interprets balance differently than the rules as written. How do you all handle this at your tables?

Looking at page 127 of the Player's Handbook, it states that balance functions based on your proficiency bonus and ability modifiers.

posts.author: SorcerousSally
posts.content:
In the new 2024 rules update, they changed how encounter? works. Now it's more streamlined but I'm not sure if it's better overall.

Our table uses a house rule for encounter? where we allow more flexibility in how it's applied. It's been working well so far.
